member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand
member.summary: UltraDataBand class. Represents a band (analogous to a table) in the data structure of the UltraDataSource.

remarks.p: An UltraDataBand defines columns and child bands. Use the property to get the top-most band. You can add columns to a band using its collection. You can also define one or more child bands using its collection. This effectively lets you create a hierarchical data structure.

member.summary: Returns true if the is set to its non-default value of false.
member.returns: Returns true if this property is not set to its default value

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ResetCachedValues
member.summary: Clears cell values of rows associated with this band. This will cause the UltraDataSource component to fire event for cells next time the values for those cells are needed.

remarks.p: You can also use the UltraDataRowsCollection's method to clear the cached cell values of a particular row collection. UltraDataRow also exposes method.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ResetAllowAdd
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value of true.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ResetAllowDelete
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value of true.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ResetReadOnly
member.summary: Resets the property to its default value of true.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ResetColumns
member.summary: Clears the columns collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ResetChildBands
member.summary: Clears the child bands collection.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.Reset
member.summary: Resets the object to its default state.

remarks.p: Note that this method clears the columns and the child bands collections.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.Move(Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand,Infragistics.Win.RelativePosition)
member.summary: Moves this band after or before the specified band depending upon the value of relative position parameter.
member.param: The band object relative to which this band will be moved.
The relative position.

remarks.p: You can use the Move method to change the order of bands in a bands collection. Note that this method is not supported on the root band since the root band doesn't belong to any bands collection as it never has any siblings.
The UltraDataColumn object also exposes method that lets you change the order of columns in a columns collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.Key
member.summary: Overridden. The Key of the item in its collection. This proeprty specifies the name of the band.

remarks.p: The Key of a band is also used as the the list name of the row collection associated with the band. ITypedList's GetListName implementation returns this value. The keys have to be unique across all the bands.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ParentCollection
member.summary: Bands collection that contains this band object. If this band is the root band then this property will return null (Nothing in VB).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ParentBand
member.summary: Returns the parent band. If this band is the top most band, then ParentBand will return null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.DataSource
member.summary: Returns the associated UltraDataSource component.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.AllowAdd
member.summary: Indicates whether controls bound to this data source are allowed to add rows to row collections associated with this band.

remarks.p: Note that this property only controls whether the controls bound to this data source are allowed to add new rows. It does not control whether you can add rows to the data source directly to the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.AllowDelete
member.summary: Indicates whether controls bound to this data source are allowed to delete rows from row collections associated with this band.
member.p: Note that this property only controls whether the controls bound to this data source are allowed to add new rows. It does not control whether you can add rows to the data source directly to the .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ReadOnly
member.summary: Indicates whether any modifications to data, including adding and deleting of rows, are allowed in row collections associated with this band.

remarks.p: Setting ReadOnly to true will prevent the user from modifying cell values as well as from adding and removing of rows regardless of and property settings. This property caues the IBindingList.ReadOnly implementation in UltraDataSource to return true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.Columns
member.summary: Columns associated with this band.

remarks.p: You can use the returned columns collection to add one or more columns.
Note: To add a field that represents a child band (child rows) add a an UltraDataChildBand to the collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.ChildBands
member.summary: Returns a collection of bands that are child bands of this band.

remarks.p: You can use the ChildBands collection to add one or more child bands to a band. The root band can be accessed using the property of the UltraDataSource.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataBand.Index
member.summary: Retruns the index of the band in the parent collection. If this is the root band, returns -1 since the root band doesn't have a parent collection.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataRowsCollection
member.summary: UltraDataRowsCollection class. Contains one or more rows.

remarks.p: An UltraDataRowsCollection collection contains one or more instances. It also implements IBindingList and ITypedList .NET data binding interfaces.

You can add one or more rows using the or methods. You can also use the method to specify that the collection contain a specified number of rows. With SetCount you don't have to call Add or Insert methods multiple times. Also SetCount will lazily create rows when they are accessed thus making it more efficient.

remarks.p: Add method creates a new row and adds it to the collection. If raiseAddEvents argument is true, and are raised. If RowAdding event is canceled, no new row is added to the collection and this method returns null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataRowsCollection.Add(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a new row to the collection.
member.param: Specifies whether to raise and events.

If this parameter is specified as True then the added row will be put in Edit and AddNew states. When a row is in Edit state it can be cancelled by calling ((IEditableObject)row).CancelEdit. The end user can cancel such a row by hitting Escape key twice on the row (if the row were being displayed in an UltraGrid or DataGrid). Cancelling a row in edit state reverts the cell values to their original values (as they were when the BeginEdit was called). When a row in AddNew state is canceled, it's removed from the collection. Overloads of this method that do not take this parameter default it to True.
member.returns: Returns the new row that was added to the collection.

remarks.p: Add method creates a new row and adds it to the collection. If raiseAddEvents argument is true, and are raised. If RowAdding event is canceled, no new row is added to the collection and this method returns null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataRowsCollection.NotifyListReset
member.summary: Fires ListChanged notification with the ListChanged type of Reset on the IBindingList implementation causing bound controls to refresh themselves by reloading the data.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataRowsCollection.SetCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the row count to the specified count. If the new count is greater than the current count, new rows are added at the end of the collection. If the new count is less than the current count, rows are removed from the end of the collection.
member.param: The new count of the collection.

remarks.p: Note: SetCount method does not raise add (RowAdding, RowAdded) or delete (RowDeleting, RowDeleted) events when it does add or remove items.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataRowsCollection.SetCount(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the row count to the specified count. If the new count is greater than the current count, new rows are added at the end of the collection. If the new count is less than the current count, rows are removed from the end of the collection.
member.param: The new count of the collection.

If the count is different, SetCount always fires ListChanged notification with Reset as the ListChanged type on the IBindingList implementaion so the controls bound to this data source reload the data and refresh themselves. However if the count is the same, this method by default doesn't fire the ListChanged notification. Specify true for the forceNotifyListReset parameter to force this method to fire ListChanged even when the new count is the same as the old count.

remarks.p: Note: SetCount method does not raise add (RowAdding, RowAdded) or delete (RowDeleting, RowDeleted) events when it does add or remove items.

You can also use the method to specify that the collection contain a specified number of rows. With SetCount you don't have to call Add or Insert methods multiple times. Also SetCount will lazily create rows when they are accessed thus making it more efficient.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.ResetCachedValues
member.summary: Clears all cached cell values. This will cause the UltraDataSource component to fire event for cells next time the values for those cells are needed.

remarks.p: Note that calling ResetCachedValues clears the internal cache of data from the DataSource, but it does not notify bound controls. This means that if there is a control bound to the UltraDataSource (an UltraWinGrid, for example) that is currently displaying data, the control will not update it's display to reflect the new data unless something occurs to make it re-request the data. To force this to occur immediately, call the method of the .

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.SuspendBindingNotifications
member.summary: Suspends firing of IBindingList related notifications. This is useful if you want to make lot of modifications and temporarily prevent the controls bound to this data source from handling events associated with the data source modification.
member.remarks:
This method along with the can be used to temporarily prevent UltraDataSource from firing ListChanged ItemChanged notifications. This can be useful in a situation where a lot of cells need to be modified however for efficiency reasons you do not want to fire ListChanged ItemChanged notification for every cell that's modified. In such a situation you would call SuspendBindingNotifications and modify cells and then call ResumeBindingNotifications. When ResumeBindingNotifications is called the UltraDataSource fires a single ListChanged Reset notification for every row collection that was affected to cause the bound controls to reload the data. To prevent the ResumeBindingNotifications from firing any notifications on resumption, use the overload of ResumeBindingNotifications that takes in fireNotifications parameter. However note that if you specify false for fireNotifications parameter then the bound controls may not reflect the changed cell values. You will have to invalidate those controls manually yourself.
Note: If the data source is bound to an UltraGrid, as expected, the UltraGrid will not fire InitializeRow event for the rows you modify since it will not receive any ItemChanged notifications.
,

member.name: M:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.ResumeBindingNotifications
member.summary: Resumes firing of IBindingList related notifications.
member.remarks:
This method along with the can be used to temporarily prevent UltraDataSource from firing ListChanged ItemChanged notifications. This can be useful in a situation where a lot of cells need to be modified however for efficiency reasons you do not want to fire ListChanged ItemChanged notification for every cell that's modified. In such a situation you would call SuspendBindingNotifications and modify cells and then call ResumeBindingNotifications. When ResumeBindingNotifications is called the UltraDataSource fires a single ListChanged Reset notification for every row collection that was affected to cause the bound controls to reload the data. To prevent the ResumeBindingNotifications from firing any notifications on resumption, use the overload of ResumeBindingNotifications that takes in fireNotifications parameter. However note that if you specify false for fireNotifications parameter then the bound controls may not reflect the changed cell values. You will have to invalidate those controls manually yourself.
Note: If the data source is bound to an UltraGrid, as expected, the UltraGrid will not fire InitializeRow event for the rows you modify since it will not receive any ItemChanged notifications.
,

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.CellDataRequested
member.summary: Fired when data is requested by a control bound to this UltraDataSource for a particular cell and the UltraDataSource doesn't have the cell value.

remarks.p: CellDataRequested event is fired when a control bound to the UltraDataSource requests value for a cell and UltraDataSource doesn't have the cell value. Once the value is provided, UltraDataSource will cache it and this event will not be fired for the cell next time. You can prevent the value from being cached by setting the to false in the event handler.

You can also provide cell values without having to hook into this event by using method. Also you can clear the cached value for a cell using method to cause this event to be fired next time for the cell.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.CellDataUpdating
member.summary: Fired before a control bound to this UltraDataSource attempts to update a cell's value.

remarks.p: CellDataUpdating is fired before a control bound to this UltraDataSource attempts to update a cell's value. You can cancel the update by setting Cancel to true off the in which case the original value will be retained. You can also alter the update value by setting to a different value.
By default the UltraDataSource will cache the new value of the cell. If you are managing the data then you may want to prevent the UltraDataSource from caching the value by setting to false.
Note that this event is not be fired when you set the value in code.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.CellDataUpdated
member.summary: Fired after a cell's data has been updated. This event occurs after event.

remarks.p: See for information on when this event is raised.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.RowBeginEdit
member.summary: RowBeginEdit event is fired when BeginEdit on the implementation of the UltraDataRow is called.

remarks.p: RowBeginEdit event is fired when BeginEdit on the implementation of the UltraDataRow is called. This typically happens when a bound control starts editing cells of a row. When one or more of the row cells are modified, is called on the row object to commit those modifications. Optionally can be called to discard the modifications and restore the original values. , and events correspond to UltraDataRow implementation of , and .
NOTE: multiple rows can be in edit mode at the same time. As a result RowBeginEdit and or can fire asynchronously for different rows.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.RowEndEdit
member.summary: RowEndEdit event is fired when EndEdit on the implementation of the UltraDataRow is called.

remarks.p: RowEndEdit event is fired when EndEdit on the implementation of the UltraDataRow is called. Typically bound controls call EndEdit on a row to commit series of modifications that might have been made to a row. When one or more of the row cells are modified, is called on the row object to commit those modifications. , and events correspond to UltraDataRow implementation of , and .
NOTE: multiple rows can be in edit mode at the same time. As a result and or RowEndEdit can fire asynchronously for different rows.

member.name: E:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.RowCancelEdit
member.summary: RowCancelEdit event is fired when CancelEdit on the implementation of the UltraDataRow is called.

remarks.p: RowCancelEdit event is fired when CancelEdit on the implementation of the UltraDataRow is called. Typically bound controls call CancelEdit on a row to discard series of modifications that might have been made to a row and restore the original values. , and events correspond to UltraDataRow implementation of , and .
NOTE: multiple rows can be in edit mode at the same time. As a result and RowCancelEdit or can fire asynchronously for different rows.

member.summary: Indicates whether row adding is allowed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.AllowDelete
member.summary: Indicates whether row deleting is allowed. Default is true.

remarks.p: Setting AllowDelete to true will prevent the controls bound to this data source from deleting rows from it.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.ReadOnly
member.summary: Indicates whether any modifications to data, including adding and deleting of rows, are allowed in row collections associated with this band.

remarks.p: Setting ReadOnly to true makes the data source read-only so that the controls bound to this data source can not make any modifications. Setting it to true will prevent cell content modifications as well as adding and deleting of rows regardless of the and settings. This property caues the IBindingList.ReadOnly implementation in UltraDataSource to return true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.EventManager
member.summary: The object that enables, disables and controls firing of specific control events.

remarks.p: The DataSourceEventManager gives you a high degree of control over how the component invokes event procedures. You can use it to selectively enable and disable event procedures depending on the context of your application. You can also use the event manager to return information about the state of the component's events.

The event manager's methods are used to determine the enabled state of an event (), to selectively enable or disable events (), and to tell whether an event procedure is currently being processed (). There is also an property that you can check to quickly determine whether any events have been disabled by the event manager.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Win.UltraWinDataSource.UltraDataSource.UseBindingSource
member.summary: Indicates whether to use BindingSource to manage currency managers via ICurrencyManagerProvider implementation. Default value is true.
member.remarks: In CLR2.0 framework, a new BindingSource data source wrapper object was introduced that solved some performance issues with binding hierarchical data sources with high number of bands. However BindingSource introduced some incompatibilities with older behavior. You can use this property to fallback to not using BindingSource.
